sect1.title: Configuring the setclock script
sect1.para: The setclock script is only for real use when the hardware clock (also known as BIOS or CMOS clock) isn't set to GMT time. The recommended setup is setting the hardware clock to GMT and having the time converted to localtime using the /etc/localtime symbolic link. But if an OS is run that doesn't understand a clock set to GMT (most notable are Microsoft OS'es) you may want to set the clock to localtime so that the time is properly displayed on those OS'es. This script will then set the kernel time to the hardware clock without converting the time using the /etc/localtime symlink.
If you want to use this script on your system even if the hardware clock is set to GMT, then the UTC variable below has to be changed to the value of 1.
